an6.71:4.1: “Mendicants, a mendicant with six qualities is incapable of realizing anything that can be realized, in each and every case.
an6.71:4.3: It’s when a mendicant doesn’t truly understand which qualities help make things worse, which help keep things steady, which help to distinguish, and which help penetration. And they don’t practice carefully or do what’s suitable.
an6.71:4.4: A mendicant with these six qualities is incapable of realizing anything that can be realized, in each and every case.
an6.71:5.1: A mendicant with six qualities is capable of realizing anything that can be realized, in each and every case.
an6.71:5.3: It’s when a mendicant truly understands which qualities help make things worse, which help keep things steady, which help to distinguish, and which help penetration. And they practice carefully and do what’s suitable.
an6.71:5.4: A mendicant with these six qualities is capable of realizing anything that can be realized, in each and every case.”
